pretty good attempt... ;)

Only suggestion I'd make to the encoder for that is to have cropped out the black parts of the film.. this would dramatically increase the video quality Substantially.
@judas 1920*800 wouldn't this mean the black bars were cropped???

Yes... 1920x800 means the 140 pixels above and 140 below (280 total) were cropped out for encoding.

There is Nothing beneficial for encoding a 1920x800 film AS 1920x1080... only purely cons.
@Judas yeah I know that  I thought you were saying that the encoder hadn't cropped the black bars but he had .
Thanx!
